conclusion: Analyze the motion of the charged particle in the magnetic fields.
Determine the radius of the circular path in each magnetic field using r = mv/qB.
Calculate r1 for B1 as r1 = mv/(2qB2) and r2 for B2 as r2 = mv/(qB2), leading to r1 = r2/2.
Determine the period of the circular motion in each magnetic field using T = 2πr/v.
Calculate T1 for B1 as T1 = πm/(qB2) and T2 for B2 as T2 = 2πm/(qB2).
Calculate the time to travel a semicircular path in B1 as t1 = πm/(2qB2).
Calculate the time to travel a semicircular path in B2 as t2 = πm/(qB2).
Calculate the total time to return to point O as t_total = 3πm/(2qB2).
Final answer: The time it takes for the particle to pass through point O downward again is 3πm/(2qB2).
